summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, seeking documentary and tangible evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's victim 'Katlyn Doe' to assist with her claim in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program or potential litigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose agents, employees, and attorneys had correspondence and made payments related to the victim Katlyn Doe.

persons.name: Katlyn Doe
persons.context: Identified as one of Jeffrey Epstein's many victims; the subject of the evidence request for photographs, videos, correspondence, gift/payment records, and documents containing her true name.

connections.description: Edwards is an attorney representing Katlyn Doe in seeking evidence for her claim.
Henderson is an attorney representing Katlyn Doe in seeking evidence for her claim.
Epstein is identified as the perpetrator of sexual abuse against victim Katlyn Doe.

events.title: Filing of Touhy Request for Evidence
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC formally requests documentary and tangible evidence from the DOJ/SDNY related to the sexual abuse of Katlyn Doe by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victim Compensation Program
events.description: Reference to the compensation program currently underway, which motivates the expedited evidence request for Katlyn Doe's claim.

keyFacts: The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC is making a formal Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's victim, Katlyn Doe.
The request seeks 12 categories of evidence including photographs, videos, correspondence, gift/payment records, and documents containing Doe's true name.
The request is made to assist Katlyn Doe with her claim in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program or potential formal litigation.
The letter clarifies the request does not seek classified information, informant identities, or investigatory records that would interfere with ongoing law enforcement proceedings.
The document references SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07771 involving Katlyn Doe.
